feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 4:13PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water In The Noatak, Kobuk And Koyukuk Valleys... The northwest Interior received 2 to 5 inches of rainfall in the past week, with the heaviest amounts in the Upper Kobuk, Upper Noatak, and lower Koyukuk Valleys. Expect rivers in the Noatak, Kobuk and Koyukuk Valleys to remain high this week. Flooding is not expected, but most gravel bars will be covered by
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 4:13PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Tuesday and Wednesday Along The West Coast From the Bering Strait To The Yukon Delta... A strong storm developing in Eastern Russia on Monday will move along the West Coast of Alaska on Tuesday, and into the Interior by Wednesday. This will bring south winds of 25 to 40 mph to the West Coast on Tuesday that will decrease slowly Tue night and Wed.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 10:47PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Marshall, western Madison and southeastern Morgan Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1046 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a band of strong thunderstorm from north through south Huntsville, including Redstone Arsenal, moving north at 10 mph.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 28 at 8:13AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR MARICOPA COUNTY INCLUDING THE PHOENIX METRO AREA ON MONDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for the Phoenix Metro Area on Monday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 26 at 9:12AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR PINAL COUNTY THROUGH MONDAY... The Pinal County Department of Air Quality has extended an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for Pinal County including Apache Junction, Casa Grande, Coolidge, and Florence through Monday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR NORTHWESTERN ELKHART AND SOUTHEASTERN ST. JOSEPH COUNTIES IS CANCELLED... entry.title: Flood Warning issued August 28 at 10:17AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. James River near Stratford affecting Brown and Spink Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. James River near Stratford affecting Brown and Spink Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 10:48PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pecos, eastern Reeves and southeastern Ward Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1048 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Grandfalls, or 17 miles southwest of Monahans, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 10:39PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Texas, including the following counties, Borden and Scurry. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 9:47PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Texas, including the following counties, Borden and Scurry. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 9:38PM CDT until August 28 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL ECTOR COUNTY... At 938 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain moved across the warned area and 1 to 2 inches of rain have fallen. The rain has ended across Odessa but flooding low water locations will continue.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 28 at 9:46PM CDT until August 29 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...High waves of 3 to 5 feet and dangerous currents are expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Door, Kewaunee and Manitowoc Counties.
